title: In a First, US Pays Tribes to Move Away From Climate Threats
description: The Interior Department has selected the winners of a new competition to relocate communities vulnerable to climate change. It could become a model for the rest of the country.
dc:creator: Christopher Flavelle
media:credit: Ash Adams for The New York Times
media:description: Mary Tunuchuk, a resident of Chefornak, Alaska, since the 1950s, where melting permafrost is causing homes to sink. Cherfornak, which received $3 million, was one of three Alaskan communities given grants to move.
